cyclone.name: IDALIA
cyclone.current_location: about 65 mi (105 km) NE of Cozumel, Mexico
cyclone.trajectory: Expected to drift slowly north into the southeastern Gulf of Mexico Sunday–Monday, then accelerate north-northeast toward the Florida Big Bend, cross the Southeast U.S., and move off the Mid-Atlantic coast near Virginia late Thursday
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: Florida Big Bend coast near Cedar Key

weather_observation.watch_coast: Pinar del Rio and the Isle of Youth (western Cuba)
weather_observation.warning_coast: Yucatan Peninsula from Tulum to Rio Lagartos, including Cozumel (Mexico)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Yucatan Channel, eastern Gulf Coast (especially Florida Big Bend), then Southeast and Mid-Atlantic coasts
weather_observation.wind: Low chance (≤4%) of sustained tropical-storm-force winds late Thu; breezy conditions with gusts 25–35 kt possible
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor coastal flooding possible in lower Chesapeake Bay if onshore flow develops
weather_observation.rainfall: 1–3 inches of rain possible late Thu–Fri as the system moves offshore
weather_observation.other_hazards: High surf and dangerous rip currents along Virginia Beach and the lower Chesapeake entrance
